p: The enhanced physicochemical stability and in vitro bioaccessibility of vitamin D 3 in corn protein hydrolysate-based vitamin D 3 nanocomplexes showing spherical structure with sizes 102–121 nm was reported by Lin et al. [ 112]. In vitamin d–potato protein co-assemblies, the nanocomplexation provided pronounced protection and reduced vitamin D losses during pasteurization and also under several different sets of storage conditions, suggesting that potato protein could be used as a protective carrier for hydrophobic nutraceuticals suitable for enrichment of clear beverages and other food or drink products with beneficial impact on human health [ 113].
